comment: Mrs Manning does her best to help you, but taking any foreign language online is going to be much harder than if you were to take it in person. The class is mostly focused on the online workbook and discussion posts with few speaking / computation assignments and the quizzes and tests aren't worth nearly as much as either. Not bad for online though

Professor Manning is a very sweet woman, but expects way too much for an INTRO class. Good for kids who have taken french in high school or have some background, but way too much for beginners. She grades pretty rough over mistakes a beginner wouldn't realize but gives nice feedback. Lots of homework. Lots. Will have to make a good schedule.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Manning is super caring and you can tell she loves what she does. There is a ton of VHL assignments that you have to do for this class but they're all somewhat easy, just very time consuming. If you pay attention to the material, you will be fine. She also grades fast too

She's a very sweet lady, but I thought this class was a bit too difficult for a first-year language course. There's quite a bit of VHL to do, and her online tests are pretty long. I hate French so I would not take her again, but she's good choice if you're passionate about learning the language.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Online. I was very confused by the organization of the course at first, and her website is a mess. But, she is very passionate about french and wants all of her students to learn. She is extremely receptive to questions. Lots of homework, a few exams, discussions every week, two oral exams, and a group project.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Prof Manning is an amazing professor!! Took her online french class and everything was so well organized and clear. It made learning a foreign language online so much easier. She is in constant contact with the class, tons of emails and video clips of what to do. The material is fairly easy and she is ALWAYS there to help if you need it!

She only spends 5 minuets on the actual grammar and most of class is spent doing one activity in the textbook. She is highly disorganized and doesnt give a clear criteria for assignments. She is a high school teacher and she treats you like one. If you like being coddled and treated like a middle schooler than she may be for you.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Manning took her time to explain how to say each word and where the sounds where coming from in your mouth. I loved this class and would definitely take it again.

Awesome professor. She knows a lot about French and is super helpful when you reach out to her. Can be a bit strict about attendance and electronics out in class, but those policies come from the department so there's nothing she can do about that. However, if you go to class and do the work then everything you need to know is covered in class.

She's from Utah so her accent isn't the best. A lot of what we do is from the book but that's expected from a language class. She is very knowledgeable about French but that leads to tangents a lot that sometimes aren't relevant. She can be a little scattered but I think that's just her personality. Not the worst teacher to have but not the best.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is an aweful teacher. She changes due dates on a whim and adds more assignments at the last minute. This class is a waste of your money. You'd be better off with Rosetta Stone. I'm good at french and make As, but she doesn't teach you anything. Don't take her unless you are fluent in french or want to spend your free time teaching yourself.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Hour long syllabus video and graded syllabus quiz to start. All the quizzes, tests, homework, written redactions, and group project do not add up to much. Exam is 25% of final grade. Didn't learn much in class, most of what I learned was on my "free" time at FLRC. Very militant. Would not recommend, would not take again.

Great professor and very laid-back class. Easy exams and homework, but be prepared to actually speak French in class and for some assignments. (Don't worry, everyone is pretty bad and Prof Manning understands we're all beginners). Only complaint: sometimes she can come off as rude when you email her, which is weird b/c she's so sweet in person
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Manning is awesome for a beginning student. Her exams are super easy, and makes participation the bulk of your grade. As long as you actually try, you'll get an A. She gets a little sidetracked at times, but the textbook is helpful, and the online work is effortless. Just do the work and look like you care and she's got you.

I've never taken French before and was really nervous at first but she is a really great teacher! She gives tons of extra credit, and really cares about her students! The book and software are really expensive but is required, you will use it every day in class. But it is helpful! I wish I could take her for another foreign language!!

She is an amazing professor. She truly cares about her students, as long as you show and effort in her class and show her you care you will pass her class. There is a lot of assignments but she is very understanding if establish a good relationship with her.

I loved professor Manning, very funny and truly wants you to learn. She will work with you. This was my fist time taking french and even though everyone else in the class had some type of french experience, I was able to keep up thanks to her! 10/10 recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Loved professor Manning. She was really nice and you can tell she loves teaching . She tries to help out as much as she can. If you're struggling, reach out to her. Do the homework!

1st class I have EVER struggled w/n my college career- but still managed to get an A. Prof Manning truly cares for her students and will acknowledge AND reward those who try and put in the effort. A LOT of busy work but worth it to help you learn French. Talk to her about your concerns and she is more than willing to give Xtra Credit or redo's

She is AMAZING. She really genuinely cares for her students, and I am so glad to have had her for 1001 and 1002. She is really patient with slower learners, but most aren't confident enough to approach her. She really believes in her students and wants them to succeed, but she won't give you a grade you don't earn. Work hard, get help, and pass!
For a Beginner's Course , needs to be more clear. Speaking in French most of the class does not help. That should be saved for an advanced course like 2002.

She was awesome. I really enjoyed her class. There are alot of assignments but they help you with the test and overall grade booster. She was very engaging and likes to take it slow but moves along very well. TAKE HER IF YOU GET THE CHANCE
